welcomeMessage: Welcome to Resend, Pedro! ðŸŽ‰ We're thrilled to have you join our engineering team. Over the next 5 days, you'll dive deep into our company culture, engineering practices, and get hands-on with our codebase. This plan is designed to help you feel confident and ready to make meaningful contributions. Remember, everyone here is excited to help you succeed - don't hesitate to ask questions!

days.title: Welcome to Resend - Company Foundations
days.summary: Get oriented with Resend's mission, values, and culture. Understand why we exist and how we communicate as a team.

tasks.title: Discover why Resend exists
tasks.description: Read about our company mission and the problem we're solving in the email infrastructure space. This will give you context for all the technical decisions we make.

tasks.title: Learn our core values and beliefs
tasks.description: Understand the principles that guide our decision-making and team culture. These values influence how we write code, review PRs, and collaborate.

tasks.title: Understand how we communicate
tasks.description: Learn our communication norms, tools, and etiquette. This includes Slack usage, meeting culture, and how we share updates.

handbookArticle.title: How we talk to each other

tasks.title: Schedule your first 1:1 with your manager
tasks.description: Reach out to your engineering manager to schedule a 30-minute 1:1 for later this week. Come prepared with questions about the team, your role, and any initial thoughts.

tasks.title: Set up your development environment
tasks.description: Get your local development environment set up. Clone the react-email repository, install dependencies, and make sure you can run the project locally. Ask your buddy for help if needed.

days.title: Engineering Deep Dive - Our Tech & Processes
days.summary: Dive deep into our engineering practices, tech stack, and development workflows. Learn how we build and ship software.

tasks.title: Explore our tech stack
tasks.description: Learn about the technologies, frameworks, and tools we use. Understand the architecture decisions and why we chose each technology.

tasks.title: Master our pull request process
tasks.description: Understand how we handle code reviews, PR guidelines, and our merge process. This is crucial for contributing effectively to the codebase.

tasks.title: Learn our CI/CD approach
tasks.description: Understand our continuous integration and deployment pipeline. Learn how code goes from your local machine to production.

tasks.title: Understand how we ship features
tasks.description: Learn our feature development lifecycle, from ideation to deployment. Understand how we separate deployments from releases.

tasks.title: Explore the codebase structure
tasks.description: Spend time navigating the react-email repository. Understand the folder structure, key files, and how different packages are organized. Take notes on questions to ask your buddy.

days.title: Team Collaboration & Workflows
days.summary: Meet your teammates, understand how we work together, and learn about our planning and communication rituals.

tasks.title: Learn how we work as a team
tasks.description: Understand our remote work culture, collaboration principles, and how we maintain team cohesion across different time zones.

tasks.title: Understand our planning cycles
tasks.description: Learn how we plan our work, set priorities, and organize our development cycles. This will help you understand how your work fits into the bigger picture.

tasks.title: Meet your engineering buddy
tasks.description: Have a 45-minute coffee chat with your assigned engineering buddy. Ask about their experience, get tips for success, and discuss any questions about the codebase or processes.

tasks.title: Join the team standup
tasks.description: Attend your first engineering team standup. Listen to how the team shares updates and ask to introduce yourself briefly. Take notes on current projects and priorities.

tasks.title: Learn about our rituals
tasks.description: Understand our team rituals, recurring meetings, and cultural practices. Know what to expect and how to participate.

days.title: Hands-on Exploration & Learning
days.summary: Get hands-on with the codebase, review recent pull requests, and start identifying your first contribution opportunity.

tasks.title: Review recent pull requests
tasks.description: Look at 3-5 recently merged PRs to understand code quality standards, review comments, and common patterns. Pay attention to how feedback is given and received.

tasks.title: Run the test suite
tasks.description: Execute the full test suite locally. Understand our testing approach, see what types of tests we have, and make sure everything passes in your environment.

tasks.title: Explore current open issues
tasks.description: Browse through open GitHub issues to understand common problems users face, feature requests, and areas where the team needs help. This will help you identify contribution opportunities.

tasks.title: Learn about incident handling
tasks.description: Understand how we handle production issues, our on-call process, and post-incident reviews. Even as a new engineer, it's good to know our reliability practices.

tasks.title: Set up your first issue
tasks.description: Review the suggested first issue about adding Open Graph meta tags to the website. Read through the issue description, understand the requirements, and ask your buddy any clarifying questions.

githubIssue.title: Website is missing Open Graph meta tags (broken social previews)

days.title: First Contribution & Looking Ahead
days.summary: Make your first code contribution, get it reviewed, and plan your continued learning and growth at Resend.

tasks.title: Start working on your first issue
tasks.description: Begin implementing the fix for the Open Graph meta tags issue. Create a branch, make the necessary changes, and test your implementation locally. Don't worry about perfection - focus on getting a working solution.

githubIssue.title: Website is missing Open Graph meta tags (broken social previews)

tasks.title: Create your first pull request
tasks.description: Open a PR with your changes. Write a clear description, reference the issue, and request review from your buddy. Follow the PR template and guidelines you learned earlier.

tasks.title: Reflect on your onboarding experience
tasks.description: Take time to reflect on your first week. What went well? What was challenging? Prepare feedback for your manager about the onboarding process and any suggestions for improvement.

tasks.title: Plan your next learning goals
tasks.description: Based on your first week, identify 2-3 areas you want to focus on learning more about. This could be specific technologies, domain knowledge, or processes. Discuss these with your manager.

tasks.title: Celebrate your first week!
tasks.description: You've made it through your first week at Resend! Share a brief update in the team channel about your experience and what you're excited to work on next. The team loves hearing from new members.

suggestedFirstIssue.title: Website is missing Open Graph meta tags (broken social previews)
suggestedFirstIssue.reason: This is a great first issue because it's well-defined, involves frontend work that will help you get familiar with the website codebase, and has clear acceptance criteria. It's impactful (improves social sharing) but low-risk, making it perfect for getting your first contribution merged while learning our development workflow.

keyContacts.purpose: Your direct manager who will guide your technical growth and help with any questions about processes or priorities
Your assigned buddy who will help with day-to-day questions, code reviews, and technical mentorship
Can help with deployment processes, CI/CD pipeline questions, and infrastructure setup
Will help you understand product priorities, user needs, and how engineering decisions impact customers
